title: Compound formed based on ionization energies

content.question:
Ionization Energies

<math alttext="(in kilojoules per mole)" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>kJ</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>mol</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>

First
 <math alttext="590" overflow="scroll"><mn>590</mn></math>

Second
 <math alttext="1150" overflow="scroll"><mn>1150</mn></math>

Third
 <math alttext="4910" overflow="scroll"><mn>4910</mn></math>

Fourth
 <math alttext="6490" overflow="scroll"><mn>6490</mn></math>

Based on the ionization energies of element <math overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi> </math> given in the table above, which of the following is most likely the formula of the compound formed between element <math overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi> </math> and <math alttext="S O 4 with a negative 2 charge" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <msub> <mi>SO</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msub> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>-</mo> </mrow> </msup> </math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="X 2, open parenthesis, S O 4, close parenthesis, 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>SO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="X, open parenthesis, S O 4, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><msub><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>SO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
